Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery dinos or krater; exterior, part of two black-figure friezes separated by thick black band: above, bird legs, to left; below, row of sirens to left (from left, part of wing of one siren; second siren, lower body missing, with added white on face and chest, white dots in fillet and added red band on hair; red and white bands with white dots on wing; at right, part of white forehead and traces of hair of third siren).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd possibly belongs to the same vase as Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.300b.1899.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 253, no. 3)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 125, no. 7)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 38, no. 9, pl. XIX. no. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.085) (phase 3)
